intro: Bathmium poeppigii, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and striking plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its unique, translucent, waxy flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its delicate, bell-shaped blooms that appear in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in its native range.
